result.execSummary:
The defendant William J. McKinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. William J. McKinney is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • William J. McKinney was found guilty of Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BOND APPLIED - fine pd in full.
BOND APPLIED - costs pd in full.

records.addlTxt: kmk
Cts.2&3 -Dismissed  kmk
From linked case #14CF605.  kk/cp

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Caspari.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  On State's motion, cts 2 & 3 are dismissed.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  Court imposes $100 fine plus costs, $200 DNA surcharge, bond applied, bond also applied from 14CF764.
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.  kmk

ADDRESS INFO for William J. McKinney
Current: 602 8th St, Oshkosh, WI 54901 United States  (Effective: 07-10-2015)
Prior: 819 Henry Street, Neenah, WI 54956

Defendant, William J. McKinney, appeared with Attorney Diane Rose Caspari.  Attorney K Richard Wells appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk: N. Jurgens. 
MINUTES: Atty Wells called witness KSD Deputy Gott; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Caspari. ST rests and moves for bind over; Atty Caspari moves to dismiss; probable cause found, bound over for trial. Information filed, reading waived. Plea of Not Guilty entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Diane Caspari  kmk
$500 posted 6/24/15.  kmk

119 p.m.  Special Prosecutor Attorney Jerrold Hinshaw appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Carl Johnson.  Clk  LE.  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 20 days; set before Commissioner on 7/10/15 @ 9 a.m.  Warrant vacated.  $500  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry).  Has $300 posted, must post $200 additonal - Cash bond reinstated - $300
